description: From Spanish trampol√≠n and/or Italian trampolino; in English, a genericized trademark based on the Spanish word trademarked in 1936.

entries.meaning: A gymnastic and recreational device consisting of a piece of taut, strong fabric or rubber stretched over a (usually steel) frame using many coiled springs as anchors.
(uncountable) A competitive sport in which athletes are judged on routines of tricks performed on a trampoline.
(programming) Any of a variety of looping or jumping instructions in specific programming languages.

verbs.description: trampoline (third-person singular simple present trampolines, present participle trampolining, simple past and past participle trampolined)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To jump as if on a trampoline.
(transitive, programming) To rewrite (computer code) to use trampoline instructions.
